DESCRIPTION: The cardinal symptom of many diseases, characterized by an increase in body temperature. It is considered the king of all diseases in Ayurveda.
A condition of the upper respiratory tract often correlated with the common cold or influenza, involving symptoms like nasal discharge, headache, and cough.
A type of fever described in Ayurveda with symptoms that are highly correlated with Dengue fever, including high fever, severe joint and muscle pain, and rash.
A class of fevers characterized by an irregular or intermittent pattern, often correlated with Malaria. The fever pattern is a key diagnostic feature.
A condition of pain in the head region, classified based on the vitiated doshas (Vataja, Pittaja, Kaphaja).
A disorder with joint pain and stiffness, often correlated with Rheumatoid Arthritis. Caused by vitiated Vata and accumulation of Ama.
